items.title: Russia fires hypersonic Oreshnik missile at Ukraine in massive attack
items.standfirst: Kyiv dismisses as ‘absurd’ Moscow’s attempt to portray missile launch as retaliation for supposed attempted drone strike on Putin residenceEurope live – latest updatesRussia’s military has said it fired its new hypersonic Oreshnik missile at a target in Ukraine during a massive overnight strike.Ukraine confirmed the attack, saying it took place in the west of the country near the EU border. Moscow said the launch of the intermediate-range ballistic missile was retaliation for a supposed attempted Ukrainian drone attack on Vladimir Putin’s residence late last month – an allegation Kyiv and Washington have said is false. Continue reading...

Moscow said the launch of the intermediate-range ballistic missile was retaliation for a supposed attempted Ukrainian drone attack on Vladimir Putin’s residence late last month – an allegation Kyiv and Washington have said is false. items.content: Russia says it used its new Oreshnik hypersonic missile along with other weapons in a massive strike on Ukraine​.

items.title: Russia hits Ukraine with rarely-used Oreshnik missile in fresh strikes
items.standfirst: It is only the second time Moscow has deployed the hypersonic ballistic missile, which was first used to hit Dnipro in November.
items.content: It is only the second time Moscow has deployed the hypersonic ballistic missile, which was first used to hit Dnipro in November.

items.title: Russia says it used new Oreshnik ballistic missile against Ukraine
items.standfirst: Russian media said the Oreshnik targeted a huge underground natural gas storage in Ukraine's western Lviv region. Ukrainian officials said four people were killed in Kyiv overnight.
items.content: Russian media said the Oreshnik targeted a huge underground natural gas storage in Ukraine's western Lviv region. Ukrainian officials said four people were killed in Kyiv overnight.(Image credit: Efrem Lukatsky)

items.title: Russia fires advanced new ballistic missile at Ukraine
items.standfirst: Russia attacked Ukraine overnight with a new hypersonic ballistic missile, a rare use of the advanced weapon in what appeared to be its latest attempt to send a threatening message to Kyiv and the West
items.content: Russia attacked Ukraine overnight with a new hypersonic ballistic missile, a rare use of the advanced weapon in what appeared to be its latest attempt to send a threatening message to Kyiv and the West

items.title: Live: Russia says it fired Oreshnik hypersonic missile in massive attack on Ukraine
items.standfirst: Russia on Friday said it targeted Ukraine’s infrastructure with a hypersonic Oreshnik missile as part of a massive overnight attack. The attack on Kyiv killed four people and injured at least 22, according to local authorities. The strikes came shortly after Moscow denounced a Western plan to station peacekeeping troops in Ukraine after a ceasefire agreement. Follow our liveblog for all the latest updates.
items.content: Russia on Friday said it targeted Ukraine’s infrastructure with a hypersonic Oreshnik missile as part of a massive overnight attack. The attack on Kyiv killed four people and injured at least 22, according to local authorities. The strikes came shortly after Moscow denounced a Western plan to station peacekeeping troops in Ukraine after a ceasefire agreement. Follow our liveblog for all the latest updates.

items.title: Russia hits Kyiv with large-scale strikes after rejecting peacekeeping plan
items.standfirst: Russia launched a large-scale attack on Ukraine’s capital, setting apartment buildings ablaze and killing at least four people, Kyiv’s mayor said on Friday, after Moscow rejected a proposed post-war peacekeeping plan. Ukraine and its Western allies agreed this week that European troops would deploy following any ceasefire, as the war nears its fourth year.
items.content: Russia launched a large-scale attack on Ukraine’s capital, setting apartment buildings ablaze and killing at least four people, Kyiv’s mayor said on Friday, after Moscow rejected a proposed post-war peacekeeping plan. Ukraine and its Western allies agreed this week that European troops would deploy following any ceasefire, as the war nears its fourth year.

items.title: Khamenei says Iran 'will not back down' in face of 'saboteurs'
items.standfirst: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei on Friday accused protesters of acting ‍on behalf of US President Donald Trump and warned that Tehran would not tolerate "saboteurs" acting as "mercenaries for foreigners" after demonstrators held the biggest nationwide protests in nearly two weeks.
items.content: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei on Friday accused protesters of acting ‍on behalf of US President Donald Trump and warned that Tehran would not tolerate "saboteurs" acting as "mercenaries for foreigners" after demonstrators held the biggest nationwide protests in nearly two weeks.

items.title: Iran shut off from the world as regime struggles to contain escalating unrest

items.content: Iran’s supreme leader signaled a hard line Friday against protesters rocking the Islamic Republic, accusing them of acting on behalf of President Donald Trump as authorities struggling to contain the unrest shut the country off from the world.

items.title: Federal agents clash with protesters day after ICE officer fatally shoots woman
items.standfirst: An ICE officer fatally shot a woman Wednesday morning in south Minneapolis, according to the Department of Homeland Security. A U.S. official identified her as Renee Good. City leaders said the victim was a legal observer of federal actions in the city.
items.content: An ICE officer fatally shot a woman Wednesday morning in south Minneapolis, according to the Department of Homeland Security. A U.S. official identified her as Renee Good. City leaders said the victim was a legal observer of federal actions in the city.

items.content: The Department of Homeland Security says the incident began with the traffic stop of a Venezuelan gang member.

items.title: Latest details after 2 shot by Border Patrol agents in Portland | Special Report
items.standfirst: Two people were shot and wounded by Border Patrol agents in Portland, Oregon, on Thursday, local police said in a statement. At a news conference, the city's mayor called on ICE to cease operations until an investigation was complete. Jessi Mitchell anchors a special report.
items.content: Two people were shot and wounded by Border Patrol agents in Portland, Oregon, on Thursday, local police said in a statement. At a news conference, the city's mayor called on ICE to cease operations until an investigation was complete. Jessi Mitchell anchors a special report.

items.title: US law enforcement clashes with protesters after fatal immigration shooting
items.standfirst: The White House said on Thursday US law enforcement was facing “organised attacks” after clashes in Minneapolis followed the fatal shooting of a woman by an immigration agent. Renee Nicole Good, 37, was killed as agents approached her car. Vice President JD Vance said, without evidence, the officer acted in self-defence.
items.content: The White House said on Thursday US law enforcement was facing “organised attacks” after clashes in Minneapolis followed the fatal shooting of a woman by an immigration agent. Renee Nicole Good, 37, was killed as agents approached her car. Vice President JD Vance said, without evidence, the officer acted in self-defence.

items.title: US federal agents shoot and wound two in Portland after Minnesota ICE killing
items.standfirst: Federal immigration officers shot and wounded two people in a vehicle outside a Portland, Oregon hospital on Thursday, authorities said, a day after an officer killed a driver in Minnesota. Hundreds protested at an ICE building, as Oregon’s attorney general vowed to investigate and refer charges if warranted, said Friday.
items.content: Federal immigration officers shot and wounded two people in a vehicle outside a Portland, Oregon hospital on Thursday, authorities said, a day after an officer killed a driver in Minnesota. Hundreds protested at an ICE building, as Oregon’s attorney general vowed to investigate and refer charges if warranted, said Friday.

items.title: Israeli strikes kill at least 13 in Gaza, including children, civil defence says
items.standfirst: Israel strikes in Gaza on Thursday killed at least 13 people, including five children, the Hamas-run civil defence agency said, despite a ceasefire that has largely halted fighting. A drone hit a tent for displaced people in the south, killing four, while separate strikes killed others across the Gaza Strip.
items.content: Israel strikes in Gaza on Thursday killed at least 13 people, including five children, the Hamas-run civil defence agency said, despite a ceasefire that has largely halted fighting. A drone hit a tent for displaced people in the south, killing four, while separate strikes killed others across the Gaza Strip.

clusters.title: NASA shortens space station mission due to an astronaut's medical issue in a rare move
clusters.neutral_headline: NASA ends ISS mission early after astronaut suffers medical issue

items.title: NASA shortens space station mission due to an astronaut's medical issue in a rare move
items.standfirst: The space agency pulled four astronauts from the International Space Station due to a 'serious medical condition' affecting one of the crew. It did not identify the astronaut or the medical issue, citing patient privacy.
items.content: The space agency pulled four astronauts from the International Space Station due to a 'serious medical condition' affecting one of the crew. It did not identify the astronaut or the medical issue, citing patient privacy.

items.title: NASA ends ISS mission early after astronaut suffers medical issue
items.standfirst: NASA said on Thursday it will return a crew from the International Space Station to Earth within days after an astronaut experienced a medical issue, marking the orbital lab’s first evacuation for health reasons. The agency said the unidentified crewmember is stable and the condition was not caused by an onboard injury or station operations.
items.content: NASA said on Thursday it will return a crew from the International Space Station to Earth within days after an astronaut experienced a medical issue, marking the orbital lab’s first evacuation for health reasons. The agency said the unidentified crewmember is stable and the condition was not caused by an onboard injury or station operations.

items.title: NASA to Stage First-Ever Space Medical Evacuation for Astronaut
items.standfirst: NASA will conduct a medical evacuation in the coming days of an astronaut suffering an undisclosed ailment aboard the International Space Station, agency officials said.
items.content: NASA will conduct a medical evacuation in the coming days of an astronaut suffering an undisclosed ailment aboard the International Space Station, agency officials said.

items.content: Star Capital is considering holding German defense technology firm Vincorion’s initial public offering in Frankfurt as soon as the first quarter of this year, according to people familiar with the matter.

items.title: Chinese Robot Maker Inovance Is Said to Weigh Hong Kong Listing
items.standfirst: Chinese industrial robot maker Shenzhen Inovance Technology Co. is considering a second listing in Hong Kong, according to people familiar with the matter, joining a wave of firms drawn to the city’s sizzling market.
items.content: Chinese industrial robot maker Shenzhen Inovance Technology Co. is considering a second listing in Hong Kong, according to people familiar with the matter, joining a wave of firms drawn to the city’s sizzling market.

items.title: CK Hutchison Is Said to Pick Goldman Sachs, UBS for HK-London IPO of Watson Group
items.standfirst: CK Hutchison Holdings Ltd. has picked Goldman Sachs Group Inc. and UBS Group AG to work on the planned initial public offering of global health and beauty retailer A.S. Watson Group, people familiar with the matter said.
items.content: CK Hutchison Holdings Ltd. has picked Goldman Sachs Group Inc. and UBS Group AG to work on the planned initial public offering of global health and beauty retailer A.S. Watson Group, people familiar with the matter said.

items.title: ‘We are not for sale’: chair of Greenland’s top labor union rebukes Trump’s call for annexation
items.standfirst: SIK leader Jess Berthelsen rejects Trump claim that the US needs Greenland for ‘national security’ Greenland “will not be annexed”, the longtime leader of its largest labor union has declared, refuting Donald Trump’s claims that the Arctic territory’s current status poses a national security…
items.content: SIK leader Jess Berthelsen rejects Trump claim that the US needs Greenland for ‘national security’ Greenland “will not be annexed”, the longtime leader of its largest labor union has declared, refuting Donald Trump’s claims that the Arctic territory’s current status poses a national security…

items.title: ‘We are not for sale’: chair of Greenland’s top labor union rebukes Trump’s call for annexation
items.standfirst: Exclusive: SIK leader Jess Berthelsen rejects Trump claim that the US needs Greenland for ‘national security’Greenland “will not be annexed”, the longtime leader of its largest labor union has declared, refuting Donald Trump’s claims that the Arctic territory’s current status poses a national security threat to the US.In an interview with the Guardian, Jess Berthelsen, chair of SIK, Greenland’s national trade union confederation, said people in the territory do not recognize the US president’s allegations that Russian and Chinese ships are scattered throughout its waters. “We can’t see it, we can’t recognize it and we can’t understand it,” he said. Continue reading...
items.content: Exclusive: SIK leader Jess Berthelsen rejects Trump claim that the US needs Greenland for ‘national security’Greenland “will not be annexed”, the longtime leader of its largest labor union has declared, refuting Donald Trump’s claims that the Arctic territory’s current status poses a national security threat to the US.In an interview with the Guardian, Jess Berthelsen, chair of SIK, Greenland’s national trade union confederation, said people in the territory do not recognize the US president’s allegations that Russian and Chinese ships are scattered throughout its waters. “We can’t see it, we can’t recognize it and we can’t understand it,” he said. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Syria announces ceasefire in Aleppo after three days of clashes with Kurds
clusters.neutral_headline: Syria announces ceasefire in Aleppo after three days of clashes with Kurds

items.title: Syria announces ceasefire in Aleppo after three days of clashes with Kurds
items.standfirst: US envoy welcomes pause in hostilities in contested region although it is unclear whether deal will holdSyria’s government has announced a ceasefire after three days of clashes with Kurdish fighters in Aleppo, which has led to more than 140,000 people being displaced.The pause in the fighting, which was the most intense in the country for more than six months, came into effect at 3am local time (midnight GMT). Under the terms of the ceasefire, Kurdish militants were to leave the three contested neighbourhoods of Sheikh Maqsoud, Ashrafieh and Bani Zaid, where clashes were happening. They would be provided safe passage to the north-east of the country, which is controlled by the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF), and be allowed to take light arms with them. Continue reading...
items.content: US envoy welcomes pause in hostilities in contested region although it is unclear whether deal will holdSyria’s government has announced a ceasefire after three days of clashes with Kurdish fighters in Aleppo, which has led to more than 140,000 people being displaced.The pause in the fighting, which was the most intense in the country for more than six months, came into effect at 3am local time (midnight GMT). Under the terms of the ceasefire, Kurdish militants were to leave the three contested neighbourhoods of Sheikh Maqsoud, Ashrafieh and Bani Zaid, where clashes were happening. They would be provided safe passage to the north-east of the country, which is controlled by the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF), and be allowed to take light arms with them. Continue reading...

items.title: Syria announces Aleppo ceasefire after deadly clashes force thousands to flee
items.standfirst: Syria’s defence ministry announced a ceasefire in Aleppo on Friday after days of clashes between government forces and Kurdish fighters that killed at least 21 people and displaced thousands, the worst violence since Islamist authorities took power last year. The army has been battling the U.S.-backed Syrian Democratic Forces since Tuesday.
items.content: Syria’s defence ministry announced a ceasefire in Aleppo on Friday after days of clashes between government forces and Kurdish fighters that killed at least 21 people and displaced thousands, the worst violence since Islamist authorities took power last year. The army has been battling the U.S.-backed Syrian Democratic Forces since Tuesday.

items.title: Sainsbury’s blames ‘significant headwinds’ for drop in Argos sales at Christmas
items.standfirst: Online competition and weak consumer confidence behind fall, although sales at group’s supermarkets roseBusiness live – latest updatesSainsbury’s has blamed “significant headwinds” from weak consumer confidence, heavy online competition and widespread discounting for a fall in sales at its Argos chain over the all-important Christmas quarter.The UK’s second-largest grocer said its supermarkets increased sales by 3.4% at established stores in the three months to 3 January but Argos sales fell 1% in the period. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump says he will ban big investors from buying single-family homes
items.standfirst: Median sale price was at $410,800 last year, according to the Census Bureau, even as Trump campaigned on affordabilityDonald Trump said his administration was moving to ban large institutional investors from buying single-family homes in a bid to reduce home prices.In a post on Truth Social, his social media platform, the US president said he will be asking Congress to codify the measure and will be discussing additional housing and affordability proposals in a speech at the Davos World Economic Forum. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Hundreds of thousands without power as Storm Goretti hits France, Britain
clusters.neutral_headline: Hundreds of thousands without power as Storm Goretti hits France, Britain

items.title: Hundreds of thousands without power as Storm Goretti hits France, Britain
Storm Goretti lashes France and Britain, cuts power to hundreds of thousands
items.standfirst: Some 380,000 homes in France were without electricity on Friday as Storm Goretti battered swathes of northern Europe, packing winds of more than 200 kilometres per hour and bringing further travel disruption after a week of heavy snowfall.
items.content: Some 380,000 homes in France were without electricity on Friday as Storm Goretti battered swathes of northern Europe, packing winds of more than 200 kilometres per hour and bringing further travel disruption after a week of heavy snowfall.
